title: Calories in Theater Popcorn
meta_description: Learn calories in theater popcorn for a medium buttered serving, including full nutrition facts like fat, carbs, sodium, and tips to reduce calories.
assumptions: Buttered movie theater popcorn, medium size (~100 g or 11 cups), popped in coconut oil with butter topping; values approximate for chains like AMC.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by theater chain, butter amount, oil type, serving size, and customizations. Check venue nutrition info when available.

quick_answer.text: A medium serving of buttered theater popcorn contains about 600 calories, high in fat and sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a medium theater popcorn?
faqs.a: About 600 calories for a buttered medium serving.

faqs.q: Is theater popcorn high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~38 g total fat per 100 g, mostly from oil and butter.

faqs.q: What about sodium in theater popcorn?
faqs.a: High at ~900 mg per 100 g due to seasoning and butter.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in theater popcorn?
faqs.a: Ask for no butter or plain version to cut 200-300 kcal per serving.
Yes, about 10 g per 100 g from the corn kernels.
